filtered_signal module¶

class filtered_signal.FilteredSignal(time, signal, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

apply_high_pass(signal=None, high_cutoff: int=None, order: int=1, fs=None) → numpy.ndarray¶

Applies a high-pass filter. :param fs: Sampling frequency :type fs: float :param signal: Signal to high-pass :type signal: numpy.ndarray :param high_cutoff: Cutoff frequency in Hz :type high_cutoff: int :param order: Order of the filter

Returns:High-passed signal.
Return type:numpy.ndarray
apply_low_pass(signal=None, low_cutoff: int=None, order: int=1, fs=None) → numpy.ndarray¶

Applies a low-pass filter. :param fs: Sampling frequency :type fs: float :param signal: Signal to low-pass :param low_cutoff: Cutoff frequency in Hz :param order: Order of the filter

Returns:Low-passed signal.
Return type:numpy.array
apply_moving_average_sub(signal=None) → numpy.ndarray¶

Applies a moving average filter and subtracts it from the signal.

Parameters:signal – Signal to apply moving average background subtraction.
Returns:Signal with moving average subtracted.
Return type:np.ndarray
apply_noise_reduction(signal=None, low_pass_cutoff=None, high_pass_cutoff=None) → numpy.ndarray¶

Applies a bandpass filter determined by some frequency analysis.

Parameters:
  • signal – Signal to apply noise reduction to.
  • low_pass_cutoff (int) – Low-pass filter cut-off.
  • high_pass_cutoff (int) – High-pass filter cut-off.
Returns:

Background subtracted and filtered signal.
Return type:

numpy.array
clean_signal(filter_sig: bool=True) → numpy.ndarray¶

Applies a moving average subtraction to get rid of global drift and noise reduction filters.

Parameters:filter_sig (bool) – Whether or not to filter the signal.
Returns:Filtered signal
Return type:numpy.ndarray
determine_frequency(time=None) → float¶

Determines the frequencies with a time array. :param time: an array of times which correspond to the signal

Returns:frequency of the signal
Return type:float
get_fft(signal=None, is_filtered: bool=False) → tuple¶

Gets FFT of a signal :param signal: Signal to fft. Defaults to signal that was read in at instantiation. :type signal: numpy.ndarray :param is_filtered: Use the filtered signal or raw signal.

Returns:first element is frequency numpy.ndarray and second is fft numpy.ndarray .
Return type:tuple
get_properties() → dict¶

Gets some signal properties. Nothing directly related to the signal is returned. :returns: properties of the filtered signal.
